sentences: Richard Bernard Halligan (August 29, 1943 â€“ January 18, 2022) was an American musician and composer, best known as a founding member of the jazz-rock band Blood, Sweat & Tears.
Halligan was born in Troy, New York.
Halligan left BS&T in 1971 after recording their fourth album, when the band began to shift to more rock-oriented music.

In the 1970s and 1980s Halligan composed and arranged music for a number of motion pictures, including Go Tell the Spartans (1978), Cheaper to Keep Her (1981), Fear City (1984), and the Chuck Norris films A Force of One (1979) and The Octagon (1980).
In 2006 he was active as a composer and performer for various types of music, including jazz and chamber music.
In 2011 and 2012 he developed and performed an autobiographical one-man show entitled "Musical Being".
Halligan died from natural causes in Rome on January 18, 2022, at the age of 78.
